data.title: Most nights are amazing
data.text: I used to serve on the Board of Directors for this event. There isn't a better place to spend a Tuesday evening in Hillsboro. All of their pictures on this sight were taken by me. I noticed that the cover photo is of a martial arts demo group. I would not recommend attending this event if they are participating.

data.title: Great place to spend some time on Tuesday evening
data.text: My first visit I sat on the courthouse steps and watched. Someone was playing music and several guys in cartoon hero costumes came out. Children crowded around them for pictures. After watching for a bit I walked down the street to see the booths. There is a nice bit of variety. I bought a flat of blue berries from one vendor. Another vendor had all sorts of vegetables to choose from. I go back weekly to get fresh greens. They have a number of eating choices and booths that sell craft items. Several flower booths to choose from as well. The flowers are $10 - $20 a bunch. The $10 are a very good size. The lilies I got lasted 2 weeks. Definitely a place to visit from time to time.

data.title: Fun date night and fun for all ages
data.text: My hubby and I love to go to the Hillsboro Tuesday Marketplace for a date night. The music is usually good and there are many choices for food. We like to frequent Primrose and Tumbleweed for adult beverages but have also had good food at Clark's. Getting produce from VanDyke farms is also a must.

data.title: Wasn't great, but fun to spend a lazy evening
data.text:
The market is spread on two cross streets, mostly on one street and around 5 blocks.
Lot of food and beer stalls in the market to have some fun. 
We tried Himalayan noodles, it was OK.
There are fruit vendors as well, I didn't find veritable vendors which I was interested in.

data.title: Family fun
data.text: Good food music cars lots of fresh food from the farm. People are nice there a little crowd but its still fun

data.title: Oh My, you have to go!
data.text: Classic Hillsboro Farmers Market in downtown and around the old courthouse in Hillsboro.  Great booths, great food, good music and fantastic people watching.  What more do you want.

data.title: Relaxing, good music
data.text: A pleasant stroll down Main Street, lots of samples, have a beer or glass of wine or cider with dinner and listen to music on the courthouse lawn.

data.title: Dinner and music
data.text:
Starts at 5pm and have food vendors and even beer vendor that are rotated to different companies. 
Music on the courthouse lawn and few other individuals down the street. 
Crafts and area stores have good things out. 
Ends at the end of August.

data.title: Quite a variety
data.text: Have always wanted to check it out and my family of 4 finally did.  Such a wide variety of food and craft vendors to check out.  There are also several choices of music to listen to including street musicians.  Saw a few friends of mine there too.  Great atmosphere to spend an evening.  Check it out!

data.title: Always Fun!
data.text: Such a fun thing to do on a Tuesday night! It's great because Tuesday night never has anything going on so it is the perfect day and time to get out and about downtown! There is lots of good food, samples, vendors, music, classic cars, produce, and much more. Dog friendly and the perfect size. If you have time on Tuesday night in the summer, I would highly recommend visiting!

data.title: fun evening
data.text: One of the best markets I have been in Washington county, there variety of food available, lots of vendors, great beer and ice cream. Love the music

data.title: Nice place to enjoy shopping for local food, flowers, and produce
data.text: This is one of my favorites. A little bit of a drive for us, but free music weekly and good selection of fruits and vegetables from local farms. Also available are flowers, jams, honey, ice cream, popcorn and some art. We enjoy choosing different food cart each time for dinner.

data.title: Great vendors, great crowd
data.text: I love going to the Hillsboro marketplace. The vendors are very enthusiastic and friendly, as well as having quality wares like jerky, jam, honey, fruit, vegetables, all kinds of prepared food, crafts, paintings, and many others. The crowd there is also very nice. Lots of kids and families, but also lots of single young people and older folks with no kids with them. I was there last summer and I'll be there again this summer!

data.title: Fun place!
data.text: This is a fun place to go to enjoy local food and entertainment. It is hard to find parking but once you do it is really enjoyable!

data.title: Lots of fun
data.text: Great local market with lots to do. They have produce vendors and lots of food choices for dinner. They also have live music.

data.title: Fun Activities, great foods
data.text: We had a great time, but be aware of bad drivers they do not yield on pedestrians. If I did not have a good instinct of grabbing my children as soon as I can, that white truck driver looks like a tow truck jacked really high almost hit us. Drivers in downtown Hillsboro do not yield on pedestrians, they want pedestrians to wait for them even in the parking lot. Have fun but be aware in crossing the street. It is better to be safe than sorry.

data.title: Hillsboro Market
data.text: I like to go to the Hillsboro market and honestly the only reason it doesn't get a five is because the food vendors serving food you can eat on the spot for dinner are a little limited.  The great thing is that the ones that are there offer very good food.  I like the fact that you can find live music going on, you have many shaded and grassy places to sit and relax and it's not as crowded as some of the other markets.  I also like the fact it doesn't compete with other market times.  The beer vendor is fantastic and so is the German sausage place.  My wife prefers the chicken skewers.  For desert, the mini doughnut place is a great substitute for a full size voodoo.  (maybe an exaggeration but they are darn good.)

data.title: Nice way to spend a Tuesday night
data.text: I've been going to the Hillsboro Saturday market for many years and to the Tuesday Farmer's market for the last 2 or so years.  It's not quite as big as the Saturday market, but there is still a good selection of fruits, vegetables, crafts and food vendors.  Most nights, there are two music performances - one at each end of the market.  The fountains are usually on for the kids to play in so it's a great place to bring the family, grab an outdoor dinner and relax while the kids play.  Most of the local stores also stay open later than usual to accommodate market shoppers.

data.title: Fun time in the summer
data.text: Very awesome street scene, great food, beer, wine music! What more can you ask for in the summer time?

data.title: Absolute foodie place
data.text: Absolute foodie place for local food and nice place to hang around. Gets crowded in evening though..
